Class ec.transform.classparser.ExceptionRange 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.transform.classparser.ExceptionRange
public class ExceptionRange
extends Object
An individual Exception handling area in the code attribute of the class file.

ExceptionRange(DataInputStream)
Build an Exception from a data stream

catchType()
endPC()
handlerPC()
Return the PC of the code that handles exceptions thrown within this exception range.
shiftEnd(int)
Shift the ending PC by the given amount.
shiftHandler(int)
Shift only the handler PC by the given amount.
shiftRange(int)
Shift the range of PCs covered by the given amount.
startPC()

ExceptionRange 
 public ExceptionRange(DataInputStream s) throws ClassFormatError, IOException
Build an Exception from a data stream

Parameters:
s - the DataInputStream to parse

handlerPC 
 public int handlerPC()
Return the PC of the code that handles exceptions thrown within this exception range.

startPC 
 public int startPC()
endPC 
 public int endPC()
catchType 
 public int catchType()
shiftRange 
 public void shiftRange(int amount)
Shift the range of PCs covered by the given amount. This is used when code is added before an exception range. Note that exceptions in the new code are not handled.

Since the exceptions handlers are at the end of the code block, they are also shifted. That is, the handler PC is also updated.

shiftEnd 
 public void shiftEnd(int amount)
Shift the ending PC by the given amount. This is used when code is added inside an exception range. Note that exceptions in the new code ARE handled.

Since the exceptions handlers are at the end of the code block, they are also shifted. That is, the handler PC is also updated.

shiftHandler 
 public void shiftHandler(int amount)
Shift only the handler PC by the given amount. This is used when code is added after an exception range but before the handler for that range.
